short_summary: The Public Prosecutions Service of Canada requires the provision of reprographic services for the British Columbia (BC) region.
description: The reprographic services required are copying, short run printing from supplied hard copy originals and electronic format (i.e. PDF), binding documents and scanning paper documents to electronic format (i.e. PDF) as specified for each Work Request.
duration_in_months: Our Requirement includes an estimated duration of 14 months from march 1st 2023 to Feb 28 2024.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Reprographic Services
A Request for Proposal (RFP) is solicited from qualified service providers to deliver reprographic services for the Public Prosecutions Service of Canada (PPSC) in the British Columbia (BC) region.

### Solicitation Details

*   Solicitation Number: 1000031580
*   Publication Date: 22 December 2022
*   Tender Closing Date: 18 January 2023 (14:00:00)
*   Duration of Contract: 1 March 2023 to 28 February 2024

### RFP Description

The PPSC requires the provision of reprographic services, which include:

*   Copying and short run printing from supplied hard copy originals and electronic format (i.e., PDF)
*   Binding documents
*   Scanning paper documents to electronic format (i.e., PDF)

The services must be delivered during the core business hours of the PPSC Vancouver regional office, which are 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Pacific time, Monday to Friday. However, specific work orders may require completion outside of these core hours, subject to the terms and conditions outlined in the contract.

### Requirements and Specifications

*   The Contractor must provide services to the PPSC-BC region
*   The Contractor must provide services during core business hours and outside of core hours with written approval by the PPSC Project Authority
*   The Contractor must follow the guidelines outlined in Annex B Basis of Payment
*   The requirement is limited to Canadian goods and services

### Contact Information

*   Simon, Nathalie (Contracting Authority)
    *   Phone: 613-716-2394
    *   Email: nathalie.simon@ppsc-sppc.gc.ca

To obtain the RFP document, please visit: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/22/ad11a9135e553c6c0cc7de05c10f9b47/2-_ppsc-rfp_1000031580.pdf
